data.title: Touch up Server.cs
data.body:
The first commit contains what I believe is important logging on error (it is very annoying when you try to start a skirmish game and you keep getting kicked from the server as soon as you try to connect, with _no_ message and _no_ logs).
The second commit contains exactly what its name says. If anyone has any requests for something else in that file that they would like to see beautified, now is the time.

data.title: Fix make.ps1.
data.body: A regression from removing the external editor.

data.title: Added Spiceblooms.
data.body: ~~I currently need help rendering the spicebloom properly.~~ Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/4462

data.title: what kinda code is this?
data.body: Isn't this red alert, doesnt that have a copyright?

data.title: Refactor TypeDictionary
data.body:
Fix a couple of potential bugs:
- When removing entries, ensure the dictionary entry is removed is the list is emptied, to prevent incorrect lookups later.
- Prevent NRE when calling GetOrDefault<T> where T is a value type and the default is returned.

General code cleanup:
- Use a single dictionary for simplicity and improved lookup performance (since there is only one dictionary to check).
- De-duplicate code in Get and GetOrDefault.

data.title: Improve hotkey resolution performance
data.body:
Create delegates to access hotkeys, to avoid reflection during gameplay.

Saved ~0.5% CPU during a test game. People who hotkey better than I do might save more :)

data.title: Team set in PlayerReference is ignored for unplayable players
data.body:
E.g. https://github.com/abcdefg30/OpenRA/commit/6b393c3cceee8d136b4cd729ecf8c2626f120226 gives me
![lockteam](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/8486156/1617f32e-2103-11e5-95b6-b0b647af21d3.png)
(I forced the Soviets team to `2` actually.)

data.title: Refactored harvester resource search
data.body:
Rebase of #7658, with some minor additions by me.

Fixes or at least massively improves #7092, #6269 and #3089.

data.title: Fixed an unneccessary and frequent trait lookup
data.body: Those are actually constant values. No need to look up the underlying trait info each path check.

data.title: Allied units will not attack a building being captured
data.body:
Fixes #6170.
Units will still attack if the intent was to sabotage the building.

data.title: Let's improve support power timer display.
data.body: Hello. I made a new PR. This is a simpler reimplementation of #7737. It organizes support power countdown timers in teams. Thank you.

data.title: Generate the selection bitmap when opening the ColorMixerWidget
data.body:
Fixes a bug where opening the widget with a red colour (i.e. hue = 0) would not generate this bitmap when opening the widget as that would not cause the selection bitmap to be refreshed.

You can recreate this bug on bleed by selecting a red colour on the widget (slide the hue slider to the extreme left), closing and then reopening the picker.

data.title: Should multiple instances of individual upgrades work?
data.body:
I have things like

```
^ExistsInWorld:
    SelfHealing@ELITE:
        Step: 2
        Ticks: 100
        HealIfBelow: 1
        DamageCooldown: 150
        UpgradeTypes: selfheal
        UpgradeMinEnabledLevel: 1
        UpgradeMaxEnabledLevel: 2
        UpgradeMaxAcceptedLevel: 2
    SelfHealing@HEROIC:
        Step: 5
        Ticks: 100
        HealIfBelow: 1
        DamageCooldown: 75
        UpgradeTypes: selfheal
        UpgradeMinEnabledLevel: 2
        UpgradeMaxAcceptedLevel: 2
    SelfHealing@WarMiner:
        Step: -4
        Ticks: 35
        HealIfBelow: 1
        DamageCooldown: 0
        UpgradeTypes: warminer
        UpgradeMinEnabledLevel: 1
```

defined. And after the talk in #8496 and related I'm not certain if this should even work at all. <del>The warminer upgrade definitely doesn't work at the moment though - because I'm stupid.</del>

Either way, the question still stands.

data.title: Added counter intelligence to spies
data.body: Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2901 as the only balancing change everyone agreed on there is that Allies vs. Allies match-up needs a counter to the spy. It will matter more when we actually make the infiltration useful like in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8210.

data.title: Fix a crash in soviet05
data.body:
Fixes the crash reported in #8613.
(See also http://pastebin.com/KRCStqfK and http://pastebin.com/MH9vV6Y9 .)

data.title: Added a Capture function to lua
data.body:
Split from #8416 as requested: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8416#discussion_r32369236

Has already one :+1: from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8416#issuecomment-113252033.

data.title: Soviet mission 05
data.body:
Tried out the latest playtest.
There are several issues with this mission.
1. The AI is completely passive and does not even harvest on the main island despite having a harvester.
2. The AI doesn't care whether it's being attacked or not.
3. Either the mission does not want to end or I'm too impatient, but after capturing the enemy buildings, destroying all allied units and having waited for about 20 minutes for the end, I decided it's time to write this bug report.

data.title: Fixed possible NREs in WithMuzzleFlash
data.body: Discovered by Coverity. Similar to https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8327/.

data.title: Fixed another null reference exception in PngLoader
data.body: Discovered by Coverity. Just like https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8312 catching it and re-throw gives a more helpful error message.

data.title: Fixed a possible NRE in Hotkey.TryParse
data.body: Discovered by Coverity.

data.title: Fixed another bad choice of lock objects in ColorMixerWidget
data.body: A followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8425 as Coverity is still complaining. The problem may be that `back` is changed in another lock/thread which is twitchy and can race.

data.title: Crash playing online
data.body:
Game was really chugging for me on this map. Happened right after another player had connection problems. Logs and replay linked. Latest release.

http://expirebox.com/download/7e20aab7b28ff6894348158479604312.html
(48h link)

http://pastebin.com/Lms5aK8t

data.title: Dispose of the old world before creating a new one
data.body:
As discussed on IRC - [link](http://logs.openra.net/?year=2015&month=06&day=30#11:26:44).
The problem was that the new world was initialized before the old one was destroyed, so they overlapped, which led to a bunch of issues that we dealt with in different ways (unfortunately).

data.title: Unable to Start OpenRa Playtest - 0628 (Mac OSX)
data.body: I downloaded the latest playtest (OpenRA-playtest-0628) for Mac OSX and have been unable to get it to start. I can start the release and all is well. I try to start the playtest and it crashes. All I get is a black screen. I don't get to the loader screen. The activity monitor shows the OpenRA process unresponsive along with com.applle.geod. I quit everything again and restarted and the same behavior. There was nothing in the logs to suggest what is going on. debug.log is empty and exception.log is un modified.

data.title: Remove unused INotify interface
data.body: Signed-off-by: Chris Forbes chrisf@ijw.co.nz

data.title: Attempting to modify an infantry sprite for RA
data.body:
Hello,

A few days ago I asked about SHP builder.

I actually have a slightly different issue now.

So I am turning a mechanic into a multipurpose unit (i.e. giving him both the medic heal weapon and mechanic repair weapon).

To distinguish him from the mechanic I swapped two colors within the sprite from a brown and red-orange color (229 and 231 in what I believe is the pallete, specifically out of the colors I'm permitted to swap in the SHP builder) to shades of blue (197 and 199).

I get this error from exceptions.log:
"
Red Alert- Globalization Mod at Version mod 1.0
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.34014
Exception of type `System.IndexOutOfRangeException`: Index was outside the bounds of the array.
   at OpenRA.FileFormats.Format80.DecodeInto(Byte[] src, Byte[] dest, Int32 srcOffset, Boolean reverse)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.SpriteLoaders.ShpTDSprite.Decompress(ImageHeader h)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.SpriteLoaders.ShpTDSprite..ctor(Stream stream)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.SpriteLoaders.ShpTDLoader.TryParseSprite(Stream s, ISpriteFrame[]& frames)
   at OpenRA.Graphics.SpriteLoader.GetFrames(String filename, ISpriteLoader[] loaders)
   at OpenRA.Graphics.SpriteLoader.GetSprites(String filename, ISpriteLoader[] loaders, SheetBuilder sheetBuilder)
   at OpenRA.Graphics.SpriteCache.<>c__DisplayClass2.<.ctor>b__0(String filename)
   at OpenRA.Primitives.Cache`2.get_Item(T key)
   at OpenRA.Graphics.SpriteCache.get_Item(String filename)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Graphics.DefaultSpriteSequence..ctor(ModData modData, TileSet tileSet, SpriteCache cache, ISpriteSequenceLoader loader, String sequence, String animation, MiniYaml info)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Graphics.TilesetSpecificSpriteSequence..ctor(ModData modData, TileSet tileSet, SpriteCache cache, ISpriteSequenceLoader loader, String sequence, String animation, MiniYaml info)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Graphics.TilesetSpecificSpriteSequenceLoader.CreateSequence(ModData modData, TileSet tileSet, SpriteCache cache, String sequence, String animation, MiniYaml info)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Graphics.DefaultSpriteSequenceLoader.ParseSequences(ModData modData, TileSet tileSet, SpriteCache cache, MiniYamlNode node)
   at OpenRA.Graphics.SequenceCache.<>c__DisplayClass8.<Load>b__5()
   at System.Lazy`1.CreateValue()
   at System.Lazy`1.LazyInitValue()
   at System.Lazy`1.get_Value()
   at OpenRA.Graphics.SequenceProvider.Preload()
   at OpenRA.ModData.PrepareMap(String uid)
   at OpenRA.Game.StartGame(String mapUID, WorldType type)
   at OpenRA.Game.LoadShellMap()
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.LoadScreens.BlankLoadScreen.StartGame(Arguments args)
   at OpenRA.Game.InitializeMod(String mod, Arguments args)
   at OpenRA.Game.Initialize(Arguments args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
"

I brute forced it later (converted the image to a GIF, processed it in another image program, and copy pasted frames from scratch), same result.

If it helps I tend to use the temperat.pal files for RA.

Thanks again!

data.title: TD Ranking
data.body:
Ranking I think is a good addition but the ranking is way to powerful. Rank 1 and 2 in example for recon bikes and infantry causing them to move way to fast for any vehicle to catch up to them. At max rank bike they move faster then the A10 planes.

Suggestion: Make small gains for ranking rather then big upgrades

data.title: The 'Jump to base' hotkey is useless if the Construction Yard is dest…
data.body:
…royed #3318

Now works like original Red Alert.  When there are no more Construction Yards the 'Jump to base' hotkey goes to the oldest undestroyed building.
